summary: Medicaid is a joint federal-state health care program that serves more than 75 million low income people nationwide. The size and complexity of the program make it vulnerable to improper payments. We testified about our 2015-2018 reports on Medicaid beneficiary eligibility and related expenditures, and discussed progress on our prior recommendations to improve program oversight. Topics include: Oversight: Gaps in eligibility determinations may increase federal...
title: Medicaid Eligibility: Accurate Beneficiary Enrollment Requires Improvements in Oversight, Data, and Collaboration
